intro: Rubus plicatus subsp. bertramii, commonly known as the Bertram's blackberry, is a shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a deep black color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubus genus.
